name: Md Sarowar Islam
bio: Md Sarowar Islam is a Bangladeshi chef, restaurateur, television personality, and writer. He is one of the most famous chefs in the world and is known for his fiery personality and high standards in the kitchen.

recipes.name: Garlic Shrimp Pasta
ingredients: 1 pound large shrimp, peeled and deveined
Salt and black pepper to taste
recipes.method:
1. Cook the spaghetti according to the package directions until al dente. 
2. Heat the olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add the garlic and cook for 1-2 minutes, stirring frequently. 
3. Add the shrimp to the skillet and cook for 3-4 minutes, stirring occasionally, until pink and cooked through. 
4. Drain the spaghetti and add it to the skillet with the shrimp and garlic. Toss to combine. 
5. Add the parsley, salt, and black pepper and toss again. Serve immediately.

recipes.name: Beef Stir-Fry
ingredients: Salt and black pepper to taste
recipes.method:
1. In a small bowl, whisk together the soy sauce, cornstarch, and 1/4 cup water. Set aside. 
2. Heat the vegetable oil in a large skillet or wok over high heat. 
3. Add the beef to the skillet and cook for 2-3 minutes, stirring frequently, until browned. 
4. Add the garlic, bell peppers, and onion to the skillet and stir-fry for 3-4 minutes, until the vegetables are tender-crisp. 
5. Pour the soy sauce mixture over the beef and vegetables and stir-fry for another 1-2 minutes, until the sauce has thickened. 
6. Season with salt and black pepper to taste. Serve over rice.

recipes.name: Chicken Parmesan
ingredients: Salt and black pepper to taste
recipes.method:
1. Preheat the oven to 375°F. 
2. Season the chicken breasts with salt and black pepper. 
3. Put the flour, beaten eggs, and breadcrumbs mixed with Parmesan cheese in separate bowls. 
4. Dredge each chicken breast in the flour, then dip it in the beaten eggs, and coat it with the breadcrumb mixture. 
5. Heat the olive oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. 
6. Add the breaded chicken breasts to the skillet and cook for 2-3 minutes on each side, until golden brown. 
7. Transfer the chicken breasts to a baking dish. Spoon marinara sauce over each chicken breast and sprinkle with shredded mozzarella cheese. 
8. Bake for 20-25 minutes, until the chicken is cooked through and the cheese is melted and bubbly. Serve hot.

name: Bob Johnson
bio: Bob Johnson is an Chinese chef, author, and television personality. She is the founder and owner of Milk Bar, a dessert and bakery chain. Tosi is known for her playful and creative approach to desserts.
